medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Two ōban sheets were joined vertically to create a large image of a beauty. Such formats are called kakemono-e (hanging scroll pictures) as they could then be mounted with paper border and backing onto a simple hanging scroll and used as relatively inexpensive house decoration by townspeople. Because of this reason, these prints rarely survived.
title: (Woman Holding a Roll of Paper)
